section.section:
A motor vehicle for which special registration plates have been issued under § 13-616 of this article is exempt from the mandatory inspections required by this subtitle if:
All of the owners of the motor vehicle meet the disability requirements of § 13-616(b)(1) of this article;
The motor vehicle is driven 5,000 miles or less annually; and
The exemption is not otherwise prohibited by federal law.
The certification required in paragraph (2) of this subsection shall be made on a form provided by the Administration.

A motor vehicle owned by an individual who is at least 70 years of age at the time of a scheduled mandatory inspection under this subtitle is exempt from the mandatory inspections required by this subtitle if:
All of the owners of the motor vehicle are at least 70 years of age at the time of the scheduled mandatory inspection under this subtitle;
The motor vehicle is being driven 5,000 miles or less annually; and
The exemption is not otherwise prohibited by federal law.

In order to qualify for an exemption under paragraph (1) of this subsection, all owners of the motor vehicle shall certify the following:
That all of the owners of the motor vehicle are at least 70 years of age at the time of a scheduled mandatory inspection under this subtitle;
That the motor vehicle is being driven 5,000 miles or less annually; and
The motor vehicle's odometer reading at the time of the certification.
The certification required in paragraph (2) of this subsection shall be made on a form provided by the Administration.

text.section: The Administrator may adopt regulations as necessary to administer or enforce the provisions of this section.
